name: Grand Theft Auto: Vice City
description: Welcome to Vice City. Welcome to the 1980s. From the decade of big hair, excess and pastel suits comes a story of one man's rise to the top of the criminal pile.

reviews.review_text: Two words:  FLASH FM.

Ignore my steam playtime, i've played this for hundreds of hours back in the day. -----------   Grand Theft Auto: Vice City, released in 2002. It was set in 1986 in Vice City (Fictional name for Miami Beach, Florida, i guess it's not hard to tell). A game that is still one of the greatest games of this era, in 2003 everyone was crazy about it. You can judge if this is a masterpiece or not by just looking at it's popularity even nowadays, how many games that are 11 years old are still played today? Not many.   The atmosphere you find in this game is perfect, your ears are delighted with great tracks from: Michael Jackson (Never liked him, but he had some great tracks), Megadeth, Anthrax, Cutting Crew, The Whispers, The Outfield, Bryan Adams, Iron Maiden, Loverboy, Slayer, Judas Priest, even Frankie goes to Hollywood, and the list goes on more of course.  The graphics were absolutely amazing at the time of release. Gameplay was, and still is great, the mechanics are friendly. You ave a variety of weapons to choose from when it comes to slaughtering random people on the street, including hookers and old ladies.  The cars you find in this game, are mostly sport ones, you also can find scooters and motorbikes.  You play as Tommy Vercetti, a mafia member that just got out of the prison. You are involved in a deal that gone wrong and you need to find the people who 'backstabbed' you'.   In my opinion, this is the greatest GTA game released, shame that GTA V kinda 'dodged' the actual GTA feeling there once was, but hey, we have to move forward!. I would love to see a GTA: Vice City remake, nonetheless.  As for the technical stuff about this game. It works on Windows 8.1 flawlessly, without any compatibility options set, or any patch or modification. It recognizes new resolutions (1440x900 user here).   A perfect game that gave me hundreds hours of fun many years ago.

Vice City is probably the best GTA that has been made to date. Obviously, as a PC gamer, this opinion does not include GTA V as that one was never released by Rockstar on my favourite platform. I personally liked GTA IV a lot and the reviews on the latest installment were very promising - I just think Vice City was more captivating than the rest.  Vice City looks dated, yes. Please bear in mind that this is an eleven year old game and considering the capacity of our smart phones this game is accessible as an Android application as the game's engine can easily be handled by our phones' hardware. Its atmosphere, however, is still captivating even a decade after its release so playing such an 'old' game on a widescreen monitor with next-gen hardware is no shame!  You play as Tommy Vercetti (voice by Ray Liotta) and you are in the '80s. You have cars, music and even film references from this era. Some scenes remind you of Miami Vice while others are clearly a nod to Pacino's character in Scarface. How cool is that?  You have dozens of missions available. Some continue the main story while other are just side missions. Each includes a cutscene with amazing voice acting so it is a crime to skip any of the available missions. Oh, you don't want to do any of these? No problem: Vice City allows the player to just cruise in the city, steal cars, crash these cars, harass citizens (with these cars, too). You can drive a cab and earn some money at your leisure. Or steal a police car and become the terminator of vigilantes.  There are tons of things to do in GTA. And while Vice City is certainly an outdated game nothing else out there can remind you how cool the '80s were than this piece of treasure.
If you like Scarface; You'll like this, mang.  10/10 - Cubans steal your coke.

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City puts in the adventure of Tommy Vercetti who tries to find rich and prosperity in the infamous city of Vice City during the 1980's. There are a lot of similarities between Vice City's story and the movie Scarface; I'll let you see for youself.  Unlike Grand Theft Auto III, Vice City is wild, colorful and of course, BAD. The world truly captures the 80's feeling, not just with cars, people or the environment, but with music. The first song you are guaranteed to hear, is Michael Jackson's Billie Jean. Other notable songs include Killed the radio star. Heck look at the tags for this game 'Great soundtrack', speaks for itself.  Bottom line is, buy it, play it, love it.

If you enjoy riding your swaggio into the sunset while listening to kickass 80s music, this game is for you.   10/10 for the soundtrack alone.   The helicopter mission was my personal favourite. Best crash simulator ever. ♥
Unlike GTA 3, Vice City is pefectly enjoyable to play and explore, even today. SilentPatch and Widescreenfix essential for playing, though.

GRAND THEFT AUTO: VICE CITY  The story of a real soldier  Unlike his shiftless brother who did time for selling drugs, Victor Vance until the last moment tried to be in trouble with the law. He even went to the army, to obtain government protection, knowledge and money, which always lacked. But even this did not help him to avoid bad influence: doing another 'civil' job of his commander, he violated the Charter and in a moment was outside the gate of military garrison.  The prospect of washing the nights dishes in the restaurants did not suit him, so the route remained single — hires apprentices to local gangsters. But how can you take seriously these clowns? The first lives in the port hangar and drunken, and the second rat and a misogynist, and a third for hours talking about their genitals. The last straw was returned from prison lance caught shaped jerk: he immediately began does business behind Vick and communicate with corrupt police. Long endure such an environment was impossible — I had to take the command in his hands.In the brothel — in a helicopter  Vice city eighty-fourth is a reduced copy of Moscow of the early nineties, when the 'white' business did not exist in principle, but the negotiations much to decide the fists and 'trunks'. Therefore, to build their own criminal Empire have literally brick by brick. Victor goes to the neighboring areas, captures the building and makes them his property, after having disposed of the former owners.  After several hours of heavy activity, he becomes owner of several brothels and gangster dens and pairs of points on the sale of drugs, bringing considerable income. The process is no less amazing than the result — I feel like a young entrepreneur who works like a bee from morning till evening. And no matter what it does not built kindergartens and hospitals — market laws are the same for all undertakings.  No, crazy action when porting from one platform to another turned into an economic simulator. Just in Rockstar's once dared to change some well-established principles, and the most striking example — a system of unarmed combat. If earlier the clothes that were only stupid to thrash arms and legs, Vic is able to conduct suffocating grappling and lock techniques of the opponent (due to military training?). Traditionally, when the desire on fighting and shooting may be time to close my eyes and instead, steal a fancy convertible, going to the waterfront to admire the red-orange sunsets, ride a jet ski on the water channel or to look at the city from the helicopter.  So good games under the brand name Grand Theft Auto that are not forced to adhere to a strictly defined lines of conduct. Vice City stories respects tradition and relies heavily on the attention of the public familiar with the series. Terse and business Victor fits perfectly into the role of the godfather of the city, continuing the tradition of predecessors: he can work before losing momentum and in a big way to relax. Sorry, will shoot him in the Prime of life at the peak of fame. But the writers released him two years he will hold in his pleasure.  The programmers at Rockstar Leeds to make the most of outdated engine everything: the picture quality here is even higher than in the original Vice City for the PlayStation 2. Even the wheels of the machines of steel volume, explosions are more colorful, and the animation movements are smooth and natural. Local radio stations for any musical taste and still pleased with the work of competent DJs. The rest of Vice city is mostly quiet and calm, as befits the relaxed southern city. Only the sound of gunfire and sirens occasionally break this idyll. The next 'Stories' turned out to be perfectly optimized for the features of the platform: helicopters obediently 'float' in response to the command, shooting at enemies easier mode avtopritselivaniya, and to steer the car even just at high speed. If here and there an accident, mostly the fault of other road users. Some missions seem impenetrable and can only be after a dozen fruitless attempts, however, after mastering all the intricacies of the task management clicking like nuts. However, neither one of them is not like another — and have the crowd of bandits to the ground to lay, and seniors home to deliver. A true Paradise for the budding gangster. This is not a standalone project, and another story on the life of gangsters that fit into the events of the series. Not just a game but a real world in which you want to return again and again.

Vice City has since I played it for the first time on Playstation 2, been my favorite Grand Theft Auto Game.  Vice City takes place in the 1980s, where you are playing as Tommy Vercetti. Tommy Vercetti has lost a lot of money, and needs to get them back. He is starting to work for people in Vice City, so he can pay Sonny Forelli back.  One of the things I was most happy for in Vice City was the music. So if you like the 80 and 90s music, you will like most of the music in Vice City.  The PC version includes a lot of new features, here are some of them:   Custom Resolutions   (Choose your own Resolution)   Better Graphics   (There is better Graphics and also custom Draw Distance)   Custom Radio Station   (Upload your own mp3 and make your own Radio Station)   Frame Limiter   (By disabling Frame Limiter, you can play Vice City in 60fps)  There is of course a lot of other new features, this is just some of them.  Vice City is of course recommended, and is a game you must play!

Back in the day, I probably put around 100~ hours (if not more) into this game on my old PS2 (May he rest in peace)  Now, this review may be a tad biased, due to nogastalia, but let me tell you first handedly, that this is a good game. My second favorite GTA game didnt age terribly well, but there arent many open world 80s games, are there now? Without further ado, I will now make a Pros and Cons List to give you a better sense of the good, the bad, and the ugly of this game.  Pros: Pretty good story, if not a little cheesy Plenty of properties to buy Nice costumes for the character Likeable PC 80s vibes all around The soundtrack is good, and has many licenced songs in it such as Billy Jean, and Video Killed the Radio Star Decent controls, they are by no means great, but they aren't to clunky either. Nice but repetitive NPC dialog Some really nice sidequests Not many bugs/glitches Decent weapons collection  Cons: The graphics havent aged too horribly, but they do look very dated The occasional bug/ glitch may still be found you lose all of your guns/ammo if you die/get busted :(  Now, even if I rule out nostalgia, I will give this game a solid 8.5/10. The fun gameworld and story, paired with the soundtrack, make for a very good game. Some may not be able to look past its graphics, but underneath, this id a good game.  TL:DR - 'Meh' Graphics are over looked by the fantastic soundtrack and gameworld, and a decent story to go with it. 8.5/10

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City  Positives:  + Perfect storyline, well made.  + Amazing reconstruction of the 1980's with authentic music on radio stations, similar cars and clothing to the time period. + Characters, especially the central one (Tommy Vercetii) are interesting. + Large array of weapons to choose from, military grade assault rifles, pistols, a plethora of melee weapons, rocket launchers, sniper rifles, the list goes on. + Open-world game where the only limit is your imagination.   Mixed:  ~ Graphics are OK, the game is over a decade old now but still entirely 3D.   Negatives:  - Game can be viewed as short, takes around 20 hours to finish.  Overall Score: 8.5/10  Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is a fantastic tale of the criminal underworld in the 1980's. Hugely entertaining game and well worth the price considering it's quite cheap nowadays.

This is the first GTA game I actually ever played, though it's my second favorite in the series. Second only from the length of gameplay though does it fall behind San Andreas, excluding that it has the best campaign of any GTA I've ever played. I remember when it came out that my desktop could barely run it maxed and now my laptop maxes it out with an Intel HD 3000. I decided to mod it up to modern expectations and after many google searches and overhauls I settled on Vice Cry as a base for expansion. Vice Cry tripled the view distance, replaced the meshes for the cars with the xbox versions (higher detail), applied a wide screen and resolution fix, and many other little things. It doesn't replace the Ginput system with the Xinput system (for 360 and PS3 controllers) but there were many guides to replacing it in the community guides that I found in a few seconds. If you can't get your mods running just use the old no-cd patch, name it gta-vc.exe, and Steam will run it fine allowing CLEO and dependent mods to run. NOTE Vice City modders prefer the 1.0 no-cd exe for compatibility reasons but I chose to use the 1.1 exe, no particular reasons, so either works if you have picky mods or crashing. ♥♥♥♥ cheats, get VC Dream and forget about them.

This game is by far the best in the GTA franchise and one of my favourite games of all time. I played it way too much back in the days (over 12 years ago as of this review) and since I now upgraded my computer I thought 'why the heck not?' and even today this game still delivers! The soundtrack, 'Miami', 'Scarface', humour, memorable characters and so on. There is simply an endless amount of things to do in this game. I loved taking over the city and owning businesses, collecting money as well as messing around with all the side missions/collectables that actually gave me some useful bonuses.  I played through this game in about 16 hours and loved every second of it. This is a standard that games of today never will reach again. I got the complete experience for less than ten euros while other games offer less than half the entertainment for 50-70€ (let's not forget DLC and season passes). Since the game is on sale at the moment I can warmly recommend it to anyone who is even the tiniest bit interested.  Buy this game! You will not regret it! 10/10.   Note! If you are playing this game on a high end PC you may encounter various bugs and glitches. 90% of them are hilarious but the annoying ones you can easily fix using google.

From 3 to Vice City even though this game was made in 8 Months after GTA 3 it is a much better game. The Vibe, Story, Graphics all of it sold this game for me. It is a fantastic experience. I liked the combat even though it wasn't too much improved from GTA 3. The Story is much better than 3 (The Main Character actually talks) and is a lot like the Movie Scarface. (Tommy Vircetti = Tony Montana pretty much) The Radio has much more better tracks in my honest opinion. (Even Michael Jackson is on the radio) The graphics were slightly better than 3 not too much improved but improved. The Missions range from assassinations to flying an RC helicopter or to being chased by a chef. Even if some missions are repetitive and annoying and if you fail it you have to DRIVE all the way back. The map is a 80's spoof of Miami, Flordia and it looks and feels fantastic. a All in all it is a fantastic experience and well worth the 10 dollars I spent on it. 8.5/10

It's the eighties, do a lot of coke and vote for Ronald Reagan.  Almost everything about this game is perfect, even on PC. Despite being one of the earlier PC ports of the 3D GTA titles it's relatively easy to control. There's a surprisingly large amount of graphics options for such an old game and especially one to come out in this time period when consoles were king in developers' eyes, so kudos to Rockstar for actually thinking this out.  I really think that the 80's are the perfect decade for GTA. The decade of decadence. Crime was getting more common, drugs were getting harder and easier to get, and the media was getting more violent. It was a time of total unhindered immoral activity. It basically screams Grand Theft Auto.  The soundtrack is amazing. I'm really into heavy metal and new wave, so I'm very biased when it comes to this kind of thing, but trust me, there's nothing like running over pedestrians in a muscle car while listening to Iron Maiden's 'Two Minutes to Midnight' or fleeing from the police in a taco truck while blasting 'Video Killed The Radio Star' by The Buggies.  There's a wide variety of melee weapons, and while the guns are nice I think the wide variety of weapons such as the chainsaw (straight out of Scarface) and a ♥♥♥♥♥ really set the tone for the game.  Tommy Vercetti is also a great character. He's beautifully two dimensional and the writers didn't try to ♥♥♥♥♥foot around that. He's a cold blooded Mafia hit man who's been released from prison after killing 11 guys and he's still ♥♥♥♥♥♥ off. He's not an Anti Hero like Niko Bellic who's just trying to get the American Dream, nor is he an Anti Hero like CJ who's trying to protect his neighborhood from drugs and rival gangs. He's just a really bad guy. If you cross him, he will kill you. If you mess up a job he's on, he will kill you. If you don't pay him, you guessed it, he will kill you. It's that simple. His American Dream is making others' lives a nightmare.  However, there are two things I don't like about this game though. One is the graphics. The models, especially the character models, are terrible. They haven't aged well, and the game was obviously made in 2002. This is especially noticeble when the various 'sexy' female characters are onscreen, because while they are obviously human, they basically look like they had their breasts and hips glued on. The wacky 80's hairstyles have a simaler problem, as do the brightly colorerd clothes that the majority of the main characters (and Tommy himself) wear. They look as if they've been painted or nailed on to some kind of puppet or mannequin. I honestly think that the models in System Shock 2 looked better than this.  The second thing is the lack of multiplayer. Add the fact that MultiTheftAuto is terrible and you have a huge problem. I understand that when Vice City came out, the main focus was on the PS2, which at that time still didn't have online multiplayer capabilites, so it is forgivable, but still, it's disappointing.  Overall, I think this is the greatest Grand Theft Auto game out there. Yes, even better than San Andreas. It's just totally tubular.

I still remember this masterpiece being released back in 2002.   This game, which is set in the 1980's not only combines my favourite time period, but also a great film - Scarface!  Much of this game has missions which relate to Scarface, and the 1980's in some way. It's a great gem, which is perfect for 1980's fan boys like myself.  The graphics on this game look similar to Minecrafts, but try not to let that put you off. This game is worth it for the story. It's a magical GTA, and one of rarity.  Rockstar unfortunately haven't experimented with a GTA game since Vice City in terms of the time period, and story telling. This is why you must try this game at all costs. I doubt Rockstar will tell a GTA game similar to that of a classic movie again.  If you love Scarface, and if you love the 1980's, then this game will rock your world. Just beware that it has out-dated, crappy graphics.  I hope one day Rockstar re-release this game with up-dated graphics, or either a GTA Vice City 2. PLEASE! :)

On the playstation 2 I absolutely loved GTA:Vice city. Before I get into particulars i'll broad-stroke the premise. GTA: Vice city was launched for the PS2. It can best be described as a sandbox adventure game. Youre given various missons and objectives by people and advance the game by completing these missions. Theres not a whole lot of missions aside from the main story but who needs sidequests when you are wreaking havock at every turn?     A large part of this game is the fun you make for yourself. Walking into this I was very excited to relive some old memories with crispy graphics, tiny load times and nearly endless draw distance. What I found was just that, except for a few small details that ended up being big problems. Remember on the good ol' PS2 when you would boot up Vice City and you had the time to walk away, get some snacks, maybe use the bathroom and sit back down and only have to wait a few moments more for the initial load? No more! Load times and load zones are no longer an issue here.     So was pretty stoked. I couldnt wait to see all(or most) of vice city rendered as once in the highest of resolutions. And this game delivered that for me too. It was a wonderful trip down memory lane, that is, until I had to take control of the main character. Unfortunately, the controls dont translate well to mouse and ketboard. At first it wasnt a problem, I used a ps3 controller. There are too many commands that have to be mapped to too many buttons, it wont let you have the same controls that you did on the PS2 version. I tried many different control schemes and ideas but none worked the way I really wanted them to. Eventually I gave up.    There ARE programs and doodads that you can use that should give you a better expierience with the controls. Also, vice city is very playable as is, out-of-the-box. I just couldnt get comforable with any controll schemes I tried. If youre looking for a GTA game you can play on an older computer I'd reccomend GTA:San Andreas. It's slightly more easier to play on mouse and keyboard. If you are looking for a little bit of nostalgia, you would be better off booting up you PS2, and digging out your old copy.

Fun and enjoyable, has an amazing soundtrack and a pretty good story. tommy (the main protaganist) isnt all that likable (well to me he isnt) but it doesnt really take away from the overall experience with the game. although i have had some problems with the frame rate and some controls not working when you turn off the frame limiter. if you can deal with those small problems then it is definetely worth a buy in my opinion. if you have are used to a smooth 60 fps on all your games and you dont think you could handle your frames being limitied to 30 fps, and a fair bit of stuttering every now and then. i dont reccomend that you get this game. but if there was one piont of vice city that i would like to push on you, it is the soundtrack. it is great and there is a radio station for pretty much everyone. but if you are after that 1980s miami vibe i would suggest Emotion. so once again, if you arent too bothered with not having a flawless and mooth experience, get this game. but if you are one of the few that could not handle even looking at a game unless it is running at a buttery 60 fps. i suggest you to give this game a shot, it really is great. and if you dont like it its not much money wasted. its GTA vice city after all

This game is just as amazing and nostalgic as I thought it was gonna be when I went out of my way to get this. Thankfully, since it's an over ten year-old game, it'll run smoothly on what ever machine you have. It has memorable characters, beautiful design that just oozes 80's, fun gameplay, and my favorite element of all.....the soundtrack....good god is the soundtrack perfect! You got it all: Iron Maiden, Hall and Oates, The Pointer Sisters, Herbie Handcock, Judas Priest, Forigner, Toto, and Many more! There are a few nitpicky things that I have with the game, like some of the graphics are really dated, and when you beat the game, there's really nothing much to do, and I wish there was No Cops at all cheat. But aside from that, It is a true masterpiece, and being my first GTA and M rated game I ever played, I loved this game when I first played it all the way back in 2004, and I still love to this day. It never gets old, and I think it's a good way to get introduced to the GTA universe.  And with that, it earns a...... 10/10! Must own! Especially at it's normal price.

Vice City as a game is brilliant and I know I'm not the only one who played close to its release and had a blast with its interesting story, charming characters and beaming setting. Memories such as the Malibu Club, Lance Vance Dance, Love Fist, Candi Suxx and of course the Mall are still present in my mind to this day.   Sadly however, as of 2015 when I am writing this review, enjoying this game, at least on PC, seems to no longer be possible.   The game has a frame limiter that is on by default that limits the game to 30 fps, however, there is an option to turn it off. Usually all would be fine and dandy from here, however, upon turning the frame limiter off a plethora of problems emerge, such as crashing, slow reversals in veicules, cutscene audio being out of sync and HUD flashing. This overall means that if you wish to even play the game steadily, you must do it at a constant 30 fps, which is really really noticeable on a game that already looks severely dated (as one would expect of course, being over a decade old).   I truly wish I could recommend this game to those who haven't played it before or those like myself who wanted to replay it again for the nostalgia as it truly is an absolute gem, sadly however, I find this port simply to be more trouble than its worth in its current state and the chance of Rockstar ever updating this game so long after its release is so unlikely it's not worth anticipating.

If you've not played a 3D GTA game I'd recommend you start here. I know GTA III was great, and many people claim it to be better, but for me GTA:VC was, and still is, one of the best games ever to exist. It's dated, yes, but even to today's standard of game it offers things that many haven't since. There are referrences to classic films throughout, and every sign is funny. San Andreas was bigger, yes, but with that space came... space, empty space. In Vice City around every corner was another little joke, or referrence. Every mission made sense in a weird and psychotic sort of way, and you really felt like Tony Montana (something that the Scarface game released after this failed to provide).

Grand Theft Auto: Vice City is my all time favourite Grand Theft Auto game. It is set in the 1980s in Miami. The missions are very well thought out and are very creative. For some reason the map of Vice City I played today feels a lot smaller than what I once thought it was playing it on my PS2 when I was younger. The soundtrack is just as good as I remembered. My favourite Radio Station was Flash FM. Although the soundtrack is amazing it is not what makes this game so good. As stated before, the missions are very good. These include Hitman missions, Rescue Missions and some of those God Damn annoying missions which involve you flying RC planes and helicopters attatched with bombs. Gang missions and Stealing missions. All these make a Perfect game. Although this game doesn't have much Replayability, when you finish the game there is a lot of stuff still to work on such as collecting all the packages. As grindy as it sounds, it actually is very satisfying when you finish it and you feel a sense of achievement.  - 10/10 Such a classic game. Absolutely beautiful in every way

Focusing on the specifics of this is old game can actually run: It can, but with some caveats. If you have a controller plugged in, you may experience the whole 'spinning around uncontrollably until you unplug your controller' bug that seems prevalent in old games. Also, there seems to be some bug preventing the options menu from changing resolutions.  Other than that, the game does run, even on windows 10, without even requiring compatibility mode. Doesn't seem to want to crash. You can feel safe indulging your nostalgia and buying this.

Impressive at its time, only OK in today's standards.   Seeing that this game was released in 2003,it was a massive improvement over GTA 3, Rockstar gave it a voiced protagonist, polished world, better mission designs and tons of nostalgia. And here is where the fun ends,  By today's standards, the game is clunky, the mouse acceleration when you aim, the horrible controls for vehicles, bad optimization for keyboard and mouse users. And sure, you had your new helicopters, planes and boats, but the missions that had those were nightmares to play, namely bombs away and demolition man. You are better off playing it on a smart handheld device like a phone or tablet.   By no means is Vice city a bad game, it's OK. I guess due to hardware limitations, there was little space for a longer campaign and more missions, but for those who want to play a grand theft auto game on a low-end pc, buy San Andreas.

What I liked about the game   • Interesting characters with stellar voice acting, especially Ray Liotta who did a fantastic job voice acting Tommy Versetti. The game also has well done cut-scenes which have a comedy element to them.  • There's so much to do, from doing main missions to doing rampages and Ambulance missions. The game is very rewarding as well, for example there are packages scattered throughout vice city and every ten packages you find you will get rewarded.  • I really enjoyed the 80's theme of the game. The soundtrack is absolutely fantastic; you will never get bored of it. The Dj's are funny and interesting to listen to.  • I liked the 80's look-alike cars, for example the cheetah looked like the Ferrari Testarossa, and the Infernus looked like the Lamborghini Countach.  • A large selection of weapons to choose from; Unlike other Gta games Vice City has a tool shop you can go to with a large selection of melee weapons. • I liked the Scarface references. • Big improvement from GTA 3; you actually have things to spend your money on now; like condos and businesses. This time round you can fly planes and helicopters, not some Dodo with its wings missing.    What I disliked or was disappointed with    • You can't swim. • When you buy houses or condos it's a shame there's no interior.  • You have to mess around with the control customization if you want to fly planes and helicopters, which is vital for success in some missions. • I wish there were more main missions.    Conclusion   Fantastic game with an amazing soundtrack. If you enjoyed the other GTA games or games which are similar, then I highly recommend you play this. 94/100
